info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 8:27PM EDT until June 12 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
FFWGSP
The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Central Mecklenburg County in the piedmont of North Carolina...
* Until 1130 PM EDT.
* At 827 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Uptown Charlotte, Huntersville, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, East Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Mint Hill, Pineville, Freedom Park, The Plaza, Southpark Mall, Hidden Valley, Paw Creek, Charlotte Douglas Airport, The Arboretum, Reedy Creek Park, University City and Carowinds.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 11:30 PM EDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 11:30 PM EDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
